intro: Quercus borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean oak, is a deciduous tree native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves and produces acorns as its fruit. It typically grows to a height of 20–30 meters and has a straight trunk with a dense canopy. Quercus borneensis plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
